thread.title: Is this video of Grayson Allen tripping again? | New York Post
thread.title_full: Is this video of Grayson Allen tripping again? | New York Post

author: Mark W. Sanchez
title: Is this video of Grayson Allen tripping again? | New York Post
text:
Coach K isn’t around to (halfheartedly) put his foot down this time.
Grayson Allen, Duke’s recidivist tripper, may have resumed his tripping ways in Duke’s 93-82 home victory over Boston College on Saturday.
Video is traversing the internet of an odd Allen kick, legs flailing in a Draymond Green impression, with about five minutes left in the first half. Being an off-ball play, there was little awareness (by the officials or internet sleuths) until after the game.
With about five minutes left in the first, B.C.’s Connar Tava set a screen on Allen, the two getting entangled. It appeared that Allen’s kneejerk reaction was to donkey kick his leg into dangerous Tava territory. Tava half hopped over Allen’s outstretched leg, stumbling a bit as play continued.
On Twitter, Tava appeared to call out Allen.
Can't stop, won't stop https://t.co/P46bgDIsZG 
— Connar Tava (@megacon_2) January 7, 2017 

Allen twice overtly tripped last season and once this year, which resulted in an indefinite suspension from Mike Krzyzewski on Dec. 22 — which lasted all of one game.
This was Allen’s second game back and Duke’s first without Krzyzewski, who is expected to miss up to four weeks following back surgery.
